Agent¶

Due is a learning, modular, action-oriented dialogue agent. Agents are the entities that can take part in Episodes (due.episode), receiving and issuing Events (due.event) with the optional use of a Natural Language Understanding and Generation model (Brain, due.brain).

This module defines the base class for Agents (due.agent.Agent), as well as two implementations:

  • due.agent.HumanAgent: a dummy agent that just logs down the Episodes and Events it receives
  • due.agent.Due: an autonomous agent that uses a due.brain.Brain to understand Events and generate new ones.
class due.agent.Agent(id=None, name=None)[source]¶

Participants in an Episodes are called Agents. An Agent models an unique identity through its ID, and handles the communication on the channel level.

Optionally, a human-friendly name can be provided, which should not be taken into account in Machine Learning processes.

Parameters:
  • id (object) – an unique ID for the Agent
  • name (str) – a human-friendly name for the Agent
act_events(events, episode)[source]¶

Act a sequence of Events in the given Episode.

Parameters:
  • events (list of due.event.Event) – a list of Events
  • episode (due.episode.Episode) – an Episode
action_callback(episode)[source]¶

This is a callback method that is invoked whenever a new Action Event is acted in an Episode.

Note that this is an abstract method: subclasses of Agent must implement their own.

Parameters:episode (due.episode.Episode) – the Episode where the Action was acted
do(action, episode)[source]¶

Create an Event out of the given Action and acts the new Event in the given Episode.

Parameters:action (due.action.Action) – An Action
event_callback(event, episode)[source]¶

This is a callback method that is invoked whenever a new Event is acted in an Episode. This method acts as a proxy to specific Event type handlers:

  • Agent.utterance_callback() (due.event.Event.Type.Utterance)
  • Agent.action_callback() (due.event.Event.Type.Action)
  • Agent.leave_callback() (due.event.Event.Type.Leave)
Parameters:
  • event (due.event.Event) – the new Event
  • episode (due.episode.Episode) – the Episode where the Event was acted
leave(episode)[source]¶

Acts a new Leave Event in the given Episode.

Parameters:episode (due.episode.Episode) – One of the Agent’s active episodes
leave_callback(episode)[source]¶

This is a callback method that is invoked whenever a new Leave Event is acted in an Episode.

Note that this is an abstract method: subclasses of Agent must implement their own.

Parameters:episode (due.episode.Episode) – the Episode where the Leave Event was acted
static load(saved_agent)[source]¶

Loads an Agent from an object produced with the Agent.save() method.

Note that this is an abstract method: subclasses of Agent must implement their own.

Parameters:saved_agent (object) – an Agent, as it was saved by Agent.save()
Returns:an Agent
Return type:due.agent.Agent
new_episode_callback(new_episode)[source]¶

This is a callback method that is invoked whenever the Agent is invited to join a new conversation (Episode) with another one.

Note that this is an abstract method: subclasses of Agent must implement their own.

Parameters:new_episode (due.episode.Episode) – the new Episode that the other Agent has created
save()[source]¶

Returns the Agent as an object. This object can be loaded with Agent.load() and can be (de)serialized using the due.persistence module.

Note that this is an abstract method: subclasses of Agent must implement their own.

Returns:an object representing the Agent
Return type:object
say(sentence, episode)[source]¶

Create an Event out of the given sentence and act the new Event in the given Episode. Agent subclassed may need to extend this implementation with some output operation (eg. print on screen, broadcast to a jabber chat…).

Parameters:
  • sentence (str) – A sentence
  • episode (due.episode.Episode) – An Episode
utterance_callback(episode)[source]¶

This is a callback method that is invoked whenever a new Utterance Event is acted in an Episode.

Note that this is an abstract method: subclasses of Agent must implement their own.

Parameters:episode (due.episode.Episode) – the Episode where the Utterance was acted
class due.agent.Due(id=UUID('423cc038-bfe0-11e6-84d6-a434d9562d81'), brain=None)[source]¶

Due is a conversational agent that makes use of a due.brain.Brain object to understand events and produce new ones.

Due is a subclass of due.agent.Agent.

action_callback(episode)[source]¶

See due.agent.Agent.action_callback()

learn_episodes(episodes)[source]¶

Trains the Natural Language and Generation (Brain) model with the given sequence of Episodes.

Parameters:episodes (list of due.episode.Episode) – a list of Episodes
leave_callback(episode)[source]¶

See due.agent.Agent.leave_callback()

static load(saved_agent)[source]¶

See due.agent.Agent.load()

new_episode_callback(new_episode)[source]¶

See due.agent.Agent.new_episode_callback()

save()[source]¶

See due.agent.Agent.save()

utterance_callback(episode)[source]¶

See due.agent.Agent.utterance_callback()

class due.agent.HumanAgent(id=None, name=None)[source]¶

A Human Agent is an Agent that uses a Human brain, typically sitting behind a keyboard, to make sense of Episodes and produce new Events.

This is the simplest kind of Agent, as it simply logs new Episodes and Events, expecting the interaction to be commanded externally.

action_callback(episode)[source]¶

See due.agent.Agent.action_callback()

leave_callback(episode)[source]¶

See due.agent.Agent.leave_callback()

See due.agent.Agent.load()

See due.agent.Agent.new_episode_callback()

save()[source]¶

See due.agent.Agent.save()

start_episode(other)[source]¶

Engages another Agent in a new conversation, thus creating a new Episode.

Parameters:other_agent (due.agent.Agent) – The Agent you are inviting to the conversation.
Returns:a new Episode object
Return type:due.episode.LiveEpisode
utterance_callback(episode)[source]¶

See due.agent.Agent.utterance_callback()
